page.title: 04PARWICH PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content:
The village school is built out of limestone and is often mistaken for for a chapel because of it's design. About 55 children attend the school aged from 4 to 11, after which they attend the Queen Elizabeth School in Ashbourne.
For a small village this is a healthy number on roll and is the result of a number of new properties that have built in the village.
On 31 August l985 Mrs. Birch retired after 28 years at the school. Such long service at one school is becoming less common.
